author: Special Correspondent
text:
As part of its Corporate Social Responsibility programme, the Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project (KKNPP) distributed 8 garbage collection autos with tipping facility under Swachh Bharat Mission on Friday.

Heads of Radhapuram, Udhayathoor, Chidambarapuram, Thiruvambalapuram, Kooththenkuzhi, Parameshwarapuram, Vijayapathi and K. Navvaladi, all under Radhapuram block, received the autos, each costing about Rs. 3.90 lakh, from R.S. Sundar, Site Director, KKNPP in a simple function held at Anu Vijay Township, Chettikulam.

On February 16 last, the KKNPP gave away 9 autos, totally costing about Rs. 35 lakh, to the village panchayats in Valliyoor union.

Speaking on the occasion, Mr. Sundar said that KKNPP was providing continuous support to the people living around the power plant through various schemes under its CSR initiatives like construction of additional classroom buildings, drinking water in schools, housing etc.

“Since cleanliness is very important for leading a healthy life, the garbage collection autos provided by the KKNPP will keep the villages clean,” he said.

M. S. Suresh, Chairman of KKNPP-CSR emphasized that KKNPP wanted the nearby villages to grow even as the project was growing gradually and steadily. “We have been doing a lot to the people and the villages around us. Hospital facilities, school buildings, infrastructure development etc. are being created under the CSR initiative,” Mr. Suresh said.
title: KKNPP donates garbage collection autos to eight village panchayats
